text: guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:34pm s : thanks so much for the questions , it 's been a ton of fun .
thanks for getting a whiff of the biff !
we 're off to munch some lunch .
love from above .
lukereklaw asks : do you wish you could continue playing in small venues or do you prefer to play in huge arenas due to the theatrical possibilities they can offer ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:34pm s : we have slowly grown to enjoy playing in large venues .
we still miss the intensity of the smaller shows , but feel we can reach similar heights in a large venue now .
it 's definitely a different experience , but one that can touch you all the same .
ryanbmuff asks : hello mr clyro , where do you see yourself in 20 years ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:33pm s : mr clyro replies , i would hope to be in the same stratosphere as a neil diamond or a kenny rodgers .
perhaps opening for streisand in vegas .
one can but dream .
thanks so much mr troll .
erin connolly asks : how many b-sides should we expect to see from ellipsis ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:32pm s : we have recorded 13 b-sides , and unfortunately in this day and age there is no side b for these b-sides .
so they will quickly become an album full of a-sides !
and yes , they 're amazing .

documents.title: 'for our lyrics i make contact with the darkest parts of my life and soul . i want the songs to matter '
text: glozboy asks : you guys are my favourite lyricists of all time , along with the smiths .
how do you come up with them ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:31pm s : for the lyrics i guess i make contact with the darkest parts of my life and soul .
and i want the songs to matter .
i never want to sing a song for entertainment purposes - music is much too therapeutic for that .
initially the therapy is for myself , i process hard things that happen to me through the songs , and i understand my reactions to events by reflecting through the music .
and all i ever want to be is honest .
and sometimes i wish i could write happy songs , but for some reason i do n't think the human psyche works that way - certainly not mine .
what means so much to me is how much the fans pay attention to the lyrics - it gives me confidence and belief in what we do .
and that 's high praise to be mentioned alongside the smiths !
simon neil of biffy clyro .
joyner/getty images punski says : put a t-shirt on ffs !
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:29pm b : no , fuck off .
you take your t-shirt off !
watch wolves of winter by biffy clyro .
jordanc245 says : when you started making music did you expect you 'd end up releasing a seventh album ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:28pm s : no .
we did n't know anyone who had released an album when we started , even anyone who played shows or gigs , so we did n't even think we 'd release our first album .
we knew we 'd make music .
it 's thanks to you guys we 've had the chance to make a seventh album .
steven davidson asks : would you ever take the current working relationship with mr vennart to the next level ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:28pm s : no , would you want to shag your uncle ?
do n't shit on your own brother .
unless it 's on his chest .

documents.title: s : 'to cheer myself up , i listen to reel 2 reel 's i like to move it '
text: evan carroll asks : what bands or songs do you guys look to cheer yourselves up ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:27pm b : burt bacharach .
any of his songs .
j : i read recently that sad music can make you happy , so red house painters , but i do n't really agree with it.s : reel 2 reel - i like to move it .
thecolinator asks : if there was a band that you would love to cover one of your songs who would it be ?
and what song ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:26pm s : arca .
i 'd like him to cover there 's no such thing as a jaggy snake .
he 's so fucked up - he 's has incredible visuals , it 's a complete package .
it 's so uncompromising and avant-garde , and he terrifies me .
stoopid asks : if you were a fan going to one of your gigs and you needed to take a wee .
which song would make a dash to the boys room ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:25pm b : if you 're going to a biffy show , have a catheter fitted .
we 're not a piss-friendly band .

documents.title: s : 'i find it easier to write songs with a specific kind of attitude , an end point for each one '
text: awaite93 asks : you speak of doing things in threes .
how long has that been the vision ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:25pm s : since infinity land .
it became very apparent that i find it easier to write songs with a specific kind of attitude , and i feel like it forces us to evolve and change and never go through the motions .
we have an end point to each one - we 're in the third version of our band now .
awaite93 says : did any of the songs chosen for the 2014 barrowlands gigs surprise you ?

guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:23pm j : the whole point of the occasion was to be surprised - some of the b-side choices were surprising and a real fun challenge to play live for the first time .
s : the most surprising thing was how many people chose songs we play a lot !
but we bowed to the will of the people .
watch animal style by biffy clyro on jools holland 's show .
theoverload says : why do you seem to be appealing to 43-year-old married women ! ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:22pm s : because 43-year-old married women are becoming incredibly appealing .
simone d'ochu asks : after watching recent bbc performances of animal style where the f-word was a no-no , do you have any favourite uses of sweary words from films or music ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:22pm s : it 's in midnight run , where the guys says something like : i 've got two words for you , shut the fuck up .
graham mckay-smith asks : cardiacs ¦ love or hate ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:21pm all three : love !
preraphaelite says : why have i only just started listening to your music ? it 's wonderful .
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:21pm s : fuck knows.b : but welcome !

documents.title: 'we constantly try to find new ground to cover and have no interest in revisiting sounds we made 10 years ago '
text: danny frost 2d ago01 would you say that biffy 's music is heading in a different direction on this new album ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:20pm s : yes .
we constantly try to find new ground to cover and we have no interest in revisiting sounds we made ten years ago .
it 's all about the new .
dean cutsforth asks : can we expect proper mental time signature changes on ellipsis ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:20pm s : no !

documents.title: s : 'i admire musicals so much because people tell a complete story in a three-minute song '
text: kerrymcdade93 asks : what would you consider to be your biggest inspiration for the majority of the material on the album ?
also how did you decide on the title ellipsis and are the two related ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:19pm s : it 's our first record that 's been predominantly influenced by non-rock music .
listening to a lot of tears for fears , a $ ap rocky , the hamilton soundtrack .
our foundations are built on rock music so all the inspirations are laid on top .
from tears for fears , it 's the production and the quirk and beauty of their stuff .

and a $ ap it 's production tricks , and hamilton , it 's the lyrics , i admire musicals so much because people can tell a complete story in a three minute song , and i find that an incredible talent for anyone to have .
finn hennessy says : were the 3 nights at the barrowlands a one-off event ?
and will fans ever be able to hear b-sides live again ?

guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:12pm s : after the next trilogy , we 'll attempt to do six nights at the barrowland.b : i 'm nervous already.j : yeah , spread over a month.s : we 'd love to play more b-sides live but we only have so much time on stage and we love the new stuff - we want to play the new songs .
captainc57 asks : which death grips album influenced ellipsis most ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:11pm s : niggas on the moon .
i love the no compromise attitude of death grips , they 're more punk rock than any band with guitars in the last decade .
and musically the influence is probably hard to hear , but we definitely share the same attitude to music .
boomblastruin asks : how did you approach rich [ costey ] about producing the album and how did you come to the decision to work with him ?

guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:10pm s : i went to meet rich last year and having been a fan of his work for years and years mew , fiona apple , the mars volta , cave in , esperanza spalding .
and it immediately felt like b : we shared a vision.s : we were coming from the same point of view .
it 's an intimate relationship sharing very personal songs with a new producer , but we knew rich was a safe pair of hands , and he cares deeply about his work and music in general .
watch folding stars by biffy clyro .
joshua hixson asks : what is the saddest song you have ever written ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:08pm s : folding stars is the saddest , from puzzle .
and if you 're a fan of the band you 'll know exactly why .
and i still find it tough to play and sing .
chloe burns says : if you were to describe biffy clyro to someone in three words , what would they be ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:08pm s : in three words : sex sells , baby .
or : what 's for lunch ? b : powerful .
fragile .
honest.j : aggressive .
tender .
playful .
id8626570 asks : if you could go back in time and be in any 80s hair metal band , who would it be ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:06pm j : motley crue ? s : motley crue are shit .
poison not so good .
quiet riot so good .
it 's not an era we take much , or any , influence from .
we would n't go back in time and be a hair metal band .
let 's just shut that down !

documents.title: 'it 's hard to cut any song from a setlist . if we had our way , we would love to play about 40 songs a night '
text: saintsrl says : what songs have you found hardest to cut from your new set list ?
what is your favourite b-side ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:05pm s : it 's hard to cut any song from a setlist .
if we had our way , we would love to play about 40 songs a night , but that does n't happen .
j : the rain is my favourite b-side .
s : bonanzoid death grip .
b : and with the scissor kick is victorious .
helen schofield asks : my question is for james .
i understand the choice of sleeveless boiler suit for hogmanay , it was freezing ! !
why are you still wearing it and will you be tops off for your arena tour ?
( please say yes ! )
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:03pm j : you 'll need to come to the arena tour to find out
camillapaulsen says : what 's the best and the worst gift you 've ever received from your fans ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:03pm s : `` the joy of playing music , man ! ''
jacob durrant asks : will you ever make an album after ellipsis which is as heavy as pre-puzzle ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:02pm s : we have no idea where our musical journey will take us .
there is every chance we will return heavier than meshuggah , but the journey could take us anywhere .
my money is on country hip-hop .
luke elton asks : would you ever release your guitar chords for any of biffy 's albums ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:02pm s : if i knew what the chords were called , i 'd love to .
sadly `` technique '' is n't on my list of things to do , so you 'll be waiting a while .
rtgoose says : as a drummer , i 'd love to know which is ben 's favourite song from the new album to play on drums ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:01pm b : on a bang has been a good song to play on drums .
it 's one of the most rhythmically expressive songs , and i get to shout some angry lyrics through the chorus which is very cathartic .
blairzo17 asks : are you gutted that you were n't in kanye west 's new music video ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 1:00pm s : we are in the video .
ben plays donald trump 's right asscheek .
i play rihanna 's vagina .
james is in fact kanye west - ca n't believe you did n't see it .
mary gallagher says : if you could create a band from musicians , living or dead ( not to include each other ) who would you choose ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:59pm b : on drums , we 'd have william goldsmith .
j : on bass , bootsy collins .
i think he 'd really gel .
s : two frontmen : john lennon and kurt cobain.j : it 's a good band .

documents.title: i can do keepy-uppys until the cows come home . does n't matter where the cows are or where they 're going home to '
text: catrin westerland asks : obvious musical skills aside , do any of you have any secret talents ?
what are some things you wish you had a knack for or want to up ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:58pm s : i will be appearing at the next world cup with scotland .
i can do keepy-uppys until the cows come home .
it does n't matter where the cows are or where they 're going home to .
j : i want to up the knack for moonwalking , and i reckon i 'm 78 % of the way there .
i just need to spend more time in airport terminals and hotel lobbies with their smooth floor .
b : i can jump really high .
for my height , i can jump really high .
i wish i had a better knack for being immortal .
i have n't died yet , but i 'd like to master that one .
id2158789 says : who inspired you to use dropped guitar tunings and when did you first use it ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:57pm s : helmet .

they inspired us to use drop tunings , and then my friend craig b inspired me to try all sorts of different tunings - he has a wonderful project called a mote of dust that you should check out , he 's a wonderful songwriter .
david barrow asks : do finished albums sometimes sound different to the way you first wrote them ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:56pm s : yes , completely .
it 's really hard to achieve the exact vision you have in your head for a record .
and that 's where the fun and adventure is , what keeps making you make new records , because you 're never quite sure where sounds are going to collide , and where you 're going to end up .

sometimes a song you do n't have huge aspirations for ends up sounding incredible , and vice versa b : something you think will sound incredible sounds like a bag of dicks.s : the bag of dicks ep is out in 2020 , when taylor swift becomes president of the usa .
abigail natalie asks : who 's your favourite character in game of thrones ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:54pm all three : terry lannister .
s : they stepped it up this season , the last episode was insane.b : the second last was insane !
caseyry asks : you say you write albums in trilogies .
if the first trilogy was the mad , experimental trilogy , and the second trilogy was the big , stadium rock trilogy , then what is the new trilogy ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:53pm s : this new trilogy is probably our `` studio '' trilogy .
we 're definitely exploring the studio on these next few records , and adopting new technologies to sound heavier and more rocking than ever .
j : moving away from the sound of a band in a room.s : fear not , we shall always bow down to the altar of rock .
robson young says : what is your favourite childhood tv programme ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:52pm s : the a-team .
b : the krypton factor.j : the snooker .

documents.title: 'your ego grows when you 're in a band , which is unacceptable at any stage of a man 's life , even teenage rockdom '
text: deniz kog asks : simon many of your lyrics refer to the ups and downs of a relationship and a deep belief in love resonates throughout your lyrics .
how difficult is it to maintain a happy marriage when you are a global rock star and your wife is a school teacher in ayrshire ?

guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:51pm s : i guess when you 're in love and in a band , it 's definitely not easy to continue relationships and keep them strong ( especially if you forget your wife 's birthday , james.j : happy birthday ! s : but if you truly love someone you make it work .
you 'd be surprised how much shit and drama our wives have to put up with .

unfortunately your ego grows when you 're in a band , and transitioning off tour into home is awkward - you end up barking orders , which is unacceptable at any stage of a man 's life , even our stage of teenage rockdom .

martin hargrave says : with the progression of the albums and music style , how do you feel the fanbase has changed and adapted through particular events , such as your mainstream fame and coverage of many of horror and the only revolutions singles ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:49pm s : our fanbase has definitely expanded .
it 's tough for us to tell , i guess b : we 're still as passionate as ever .
s : the main thing is that people feel as passionate as ever .
it 's important that people not know who we are , but know our music - it 's important that we embrace chance , evolution embraces .
the important thing is that we do n't think it has changed a thing about the band , even if the fanbase has shifted and morphed .
prs960 asks : simon , i was wondering when your zzc album will be coming out ?
i loved to the bone guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:47pm s : the album will come out some point next year .
it was an important step in creating this biffy album and i did n't want anyone to think i was turning into an egomaniac .
zzc , i felt like i was creatively constipated , and zzc was the diuretic that helped my intestines flow .
though that does n't mean it 's full of shit .
and it 's a whole different flavour - completely electronic , and most of the songs are about six minutes long .
fans of tool need not apply .
hufc biffy asks : which song is your favourite to play live ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:46pm b : animal style , it 's so exciting when a song is catching on in the public eye , and you get to see it build in a live situation .
j : wolves of winter , it 's at the start of the set , and you 're still in the position of not knowing how it 's going to go - anything could happen and it usually does .
s : rearrange , because i can get in touch with my feminine side .
`` cinnamon '' is in the building .

documents.title: advice to younger self ? have faith . and enjoy it !
text: maggs46 asks : if you could give your younger selves some advice what would it be ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:45pm s : have faith .
`` and just enjoy it ! ''
i said that in a scottish manc accent .
scanc .
joelf15 says : you guys have seriously changed everything for me musically , and have really helped me as a musician !
my question for you is this : what advice would you give to a young band that are trying to get out there ?
thank you for the music .
mon the biff !
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:44pm j : glad that you 've found the light !
b : i 'm not answering this one j : find people that you enjoy making music with and spending time with .
s : no , music should come second - find people you enjoy spending time with , and then make music with them .
alison harvey also asks : would you rather fight , 1 horse sized duck or 100 duck sized horses ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:43pm s : 100 duck sized horses , because i could kick the living shit out of them .
in the most respectful way to animals possible .
we do not endorse kicking duck-sized horses .
and i would run the other way from a horse-sized duck .

documents.title: 'it would be futile to give the real reason behind the name at this stage '
text: alison harvey asks : are ben & james sick of people thinking simon is 1 guy called biffy clyro ?
guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:42pm j : no , we 're not .
we think it 's pretty funny when it happens , and reminds us why we chose the name in the first place , which was to confuse people and twist their minds .
s : it would be futile to give the real reason behind the name at this stage .
b : we actually have a couple times , and people are like `` ok ``
patrick saad fahim says : first of all mon the biffy i am so very happy to get a few new songs i can listen to for the next two years !
finally biffy are back !
i 'd like to know if you guys plan to release a b-side album after the release of ellipsis similar to lonely revolutions or similarities .
forgive my bad english and mon the biffy from germany guardian contributor biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:41pm b : yes !
it 'll be called punkt punkt punkt - dot dot dot in german - and was recorded concurrently with ellipsis .
nicolas recazin asks : simon you 're one of my favourite songwriters and i 'd like to know what was the hardest lyrics for you to write on this new album ?
biffyclyro 05 july 2016 12:39pm s : the trickiest lyrics are always the ones regarding current relationships , because i do n't really want to upset anyone but i have a duty to be honest .
rearrange would be a tough one .
i find lyrics generally quite tricky - i spend a reasonable amount of time on them .
yes , we worked reasonably hard on this !
biffy clyro are with us now biffy clyro ¦ ( left to right ) james johnston , simon neil and ben johnston .
beaumont-thomas/the guardian

documents.title: post your questions for biffy clyro
text: biffy clyro have been building their way towards stadiums for over 20 years .
the kilmarnock trio may have started out as awkward schoolboys , but they 've evolved into tattoo-covered rock gods with millions of fans .
their 2009 album only revolutions was nominated for the mercury prize , while the most recent , opposites , went to no 1 ; new album ellipsis could well do the same when it comes out this week .
they 've been upfront about everything from their alcohol problems to struggles with mental health and grief .

everything , in fact , except for the origin of their band name , variously claiming it 's the name of a scottish footballer , a scottish astronaut , and an acronym for big imagination for feeling young cos life yearns real optimism .
ahead of the release of ellipsis , they 're joining us to answer your questions in a live webchat , from 12.30pm bst on tuesday 5 july .
post them in the comments section below , and they 'll answer as many as possible .
